content-model-wikibase-lexeme: The name for Wikibase Lexeme content model, used when describing what type of content a page contains.
datatypes-type-wikibase-form:
The name of a data type for lexicographical Forms in Wikibase.
{{related|Datatypes-type}}
datatypes-type-wikibase-sense:
The name of a data type for Senses in Wikibase.
{{related|Datatypes-type}}
nstab-lexeme: Tab title for pages in the Lexeme namespace.
tooltip-ca-nstab-lexeme: Tooltip for the tab title for pages in the Lexeme namespace.
wikibase-entity-summary-wblmergelexemes-:
Automatic edit summary when merging lexemes. This summary is for the edit made to the lexeme being merged TO.

Parameters:
* $1 - (Unused)
* $2 - (Unused)
* $3 - the lexeme id of the lexeme being merged from

Note that some item-specific messages need to be defined with the generic wikibase-entity-summary prefix for use on client wikis.
{{Related|Wikibase-entity-summary}}

Automatic edit summary when merging lexemes. This summary is for the edit made to the lexeme being merged FROM.

Parameters:
* $1 - (Unused)
* $2 - (Unused)
* $3 - the lexeme id of the lexeme being merged to

Note that some item-specific messages need to be defined with the generic wikibase-entity-summary prefix for use on client wikis.
{{Related|Wikibase-entity-summary}}
wikibase-lexeme-gloss-empty: Placeholder message displayed instead of the gloss of the Sense in case the gloss in the display language has not been specified yet.
wikibase-lexeme-language-selector-label:
{{optional}}
Template for generating LanguageSelector options

 Parameters:
* $1 the Language Name
* $2 the Language code
wikibase-lexeme-lemma-language-not-recog: Error message shown if the lemma language selected is not in the range of options.
wikibase-lexeme-lemma-language-option:
{{optional}}
Template for generating lemma language options

Parameters:
* $1 - Name of the language
* $2 - Language code
wikibase-lexeme-mergelexemes-error-canno: Error message that is displayed when the Lexeme cannot be loaded
wikibase-lexeme-mergelexemes-error-confl: Error message that is displayed when the Lexemes to be merged have different Lemmas in the same spelling variant
wikibase-lexeme-mergelexemes-error-cross: Error message that is displayed when the Lexemes to be merged link to each other in statements
wikibase-lexeme-mergelexemes-error-faile: Error message that is displayed when the Lexeme cannot be modified
Error message that is displayed when the Lexeme cannot be saved
wikibase-lexeme-mergelexemes-error-inval:
Error message that is displayed when given an invalid Lexeme id

Parameters:
* $1 - Lexeme id
wikibase-lexeme-mergelexemes-error-lexem:
Error message that is displayed when the lexeme for a given id is not found

Parameters:
* $1 - Lexeme id
wikibase-lexeme-mergelexemes-error-permi: Error message that is displayed when the user does not have the permissions to merge the Lexemes
wikibase-lexeme-mergelexemes-error-same-: Error message that is displayed when the lexemes to be merged have the same language
Error message that is displayed when the lexemes to be merged are identical
Error message that is displayed when the Lexemes to be merged have the same lexical category
wikibase-lexeme-mergelexemes-from-id:
Label for the input field to select the ID of the entity to merge from. See also:
* {{msg-mw|Wikibase-lexeme-mergelexemes-to-id}}
wikibase-lexeme-mergelexemes-success:
Message that is displayed after a successful merge

Parameters:
* $1 - Source Lexeme link
* $2 - Target Lexeme link
wikibase-lexeme-mergelexemes-to-id:
Label for the input field to select the ID of the entity to merge to. See also:
* {{msg-mw|Wikibase-lexeme-mergelexemes-from-id}}
wikibase-lexeme-summary-add-form:
{{wikibase summary messages|lexeme|Automatic edit summary generated when adding new lexicographical Form to a Lexeme.}}

Parameters:
* $1 - Number of representations of the lexicographical Form added.
* $2 - empty.
* $3 - lexicographical Form ID.
wikibase-lexeme-summary-add-form-grammat:
{{wikibase summary messages|lexeme|Automatic edit summary generated when adding grammatical features. Example of a full edit summary is "Added grammatical feature of lexicographical Form L1-F2: [[Item:Q123]]".}}

Parameters:
* $1 - Number of grammatical features added.
* $2 - empty.
* $3 - lexicographical Form ID.
wikibase-lexeme-summary-add-form-represe:
{{wikibase summary messages|lexeme|Automatic edit summary generated when adding lexicographical Form representations. Example of a full edit summary is "Added representation of lexicographical Form L1-F2: en-us: color".}}

Parameters:
* $1 - Number of representations added.
* $2 - empty.
* $3 - lexicographical Form ID.
wikibase-lexeme-summary-add-sense:
{{wikibase summary messages|lexeme|Automatic edit summary generated when adding a new Sense to a Lexeme.}}

Parameters:
* $1 is the number of glosses of the Sense added.
* $2 is the language code of the Sense's gloss if there is only a single gloss.
* $3 is the sense ID.
wikibase-lexeme-summary-add-sense-glosse:
{{wikibase summary messages|lexeme|Automatic edit summary generated when adding glosses to a Sense.}}

Parameters:
* $1 is the number of glosses added.
* $2 is the language code of the added gloss if only a single gloss was added.
* $3 is the sense ID.
wikibase-lexeme-summary-remove-form:
{{wikibase summary messages|lexeme|Automatic edit summary generated when removing a lexicographical Form from a Lexeme.}}

Parameters:
* $1 - Number of representations of the lexicographical Form removed.
* $2 - empty.
* $3 - lexicographical Form ID.
wikibase-lexeme-summary-remove-sense:
{{wikibase summary messages|lexeme|Automatic edit summary generated when removing a Sense from a Lexeme.}}

Parameters:
* $1 is the number of glosses of the Sense removed.
* $2 is the language code of the Sense's gloss if there is only a single gloss.
* $3 is the sense ID.
wikibase-lexeme-summary-remove-sense-glo:
{{wikibase summary messages|lexeme|Automatic edit summary generated when removing glosses of a Sense.}}

Parameters:
* $1 is the number of glosses removed.
* $2 is the language code of the removed gloss if only a single gloss was removed.
* $3 is the sense ID.
wikibase-lexeme-summary-set-sense-glosse:
{{wikibase summary messages|lexeme|Automatic edit summary generated when changing glosses of a Sense.}}

Parameters:
* $1 is the number of glosses changed.
* $2 is the language code of the changed gloss if only a single gloss was changed.
* $3 is the sense ID.
wikibase-lexeme-summary-wbeditentity-cre: {{wikibase summary messages|lexeme|Automatic edit summary generated when adding a new lexicographical Form to a Lexeme.}}
{{wikibase summary messages|lexeme|Automatic edit summary generated when creating a new Lexeme.}}
{{wikibase summary messages|lexeme|Automatic edit summary generated when adding a new Sense to a Lexeme.}}
wikibase-lexeme-summary-wbeditentity-upd: Auto-generated edit summary when editing a Lexeme
wikibase-pageinfo-wbl-forms: Label for page information on number of Forms
wikibase-pageinfo-wbl-senses: Label for page information on number of Senses
wikibase-validator-form-not-found:
Error message that is being reported when Form with provided ID does not exist.

Parameters:
* $1 - ID of the Form
wikibaselexeme-add-form: Label for button to add a new lexicographical Form
wikibaselexeme-add-sense: Label for button to add a new Sense
wikibaselexeme-description:
{{optional}}
Template for generating Lexeme description: Language + Lexical Category
wikibaselexeme-diffview-form: Title of lexicographical Form in diff page
wikibaselexeme-diffview-gloss: Title of gloss in diff page
wikibaselexeme-diffview-grammatical-feat: Title of grammatical feature in diff page
wikibaselexeme-diffview-language:
Title of language in diff page
{{Identical|Language}}
wikibaselexeme-diffview-lemma: Title of lemma in diff page
wikibaselexeme-diffview-lexical-category: Title of lexical category in diff page
wikibaselexeme-diffview-representation: Title of representation in diff page
wikibaselexeme-diffview-sense:
Title of Sense in diff page
{{Identical|Sense}}
wikibaselexeme-empty-form-representation: Placeholder message displayed instead of the Lexeme lexicographical Form representation in case no representation has been specified yet.
wikibaselexeme-enter-form-representation: Placeholder for the Lexeme lexicographical Form representation input field.
wikibaselexeme-error-cannot-remove-last-: Error message that is being reported when the last lemma is being removed.
wikibaselexeme-field-language-label:
Label for the Lexeme language field in the Lexeme header
{{Identical|Language}}
wikibaselexeme-field-lexical-category-la: Label for the Lexeme lexical category field in the Lexeme header
wikibaselexeme-form-description:
Template for generating a description of a Form, used when displaying search results. Parameters:
* $1 - grammatical features
* $2 - Lemma
* $3 - Lexeme ID
* $4 - computed Lemma description

Example: [https://www.wikidata.org/w/index.php?search=%22fires%22&title=Special%3ASearch&profile=advanced&fulltext=1&advancedSearch-current=%7B%22namespaces%22%3A%5B146%5D%7D&ns146=1 Search for "fires" on wikidata]
wikibaselexeme-form-field-language-label: Label of the field to input the spelling variant code of the Form representation
wikibaselexeme-form-field-representation:
Label of the field to input the representation of the Form
{{Identical|Representation}}
wikibaselexeme-form-field-required: Hint message to indicate that a form field is required. Shown on hover over a required-indicator (asterisk, '*')
wikibaselexeme-form-grammatical-features: Label for the list of a form's grammatical features
wikibaselexeme-form-representation-redun: Error message to show if multiple form representations with same language are provided
wikibaselexeme-formidformatter-link-titl:
{{optional}}

Value of the "title" attribute of a link to form page when the form is displayed as HTML.

Parameters:
* $1 - Form ID
* $2 - Form's "secondary label" (grammatical features).
wikibaselexeme-formidformatter-separator:
{{optional}}

Delimiter used to separate grammatical features of a lexeme form when the Form ID is being displayed as text/HTML.

{{optional}}

Delimiter used to separate multiple representations of the form when the Form ID is being displayed as text/HTML.
wikibaselexeme-gloss-field-gloss-label:
Label of the field to input the gloss of the Sense
{{Identical|Gloss}}
wikibaselexeme-gloss-field-language-labe:
Label of the field to input the language code of the language the gloss of the Sense is defined in
{{Identical|Language}}
wikibaselexeme-grammatical-features-inpu: Placeholder for the grammatical features input field
wikibaselexeme-header-forms: Subheading for the '''lexicographical forms''' (not forms of tables or dialogs) section on a Lexeme page.
wikibaselexeme-header-senses:
Subheading for the Senses section on a Lexeme page.
{{Identical|Sense}}
wikibaselexeme-lemma-field-language-labe: Label of the field to input the spelling variant code of the lemma
wikibaselexeme-lemma-field-lemma-label:
Label of the field to input the lemma of the Lexeme.
{{Identical|Lemma}}
wikibaselexeme-lemma-redundant-language: Error message to show if multiple lemma with same language are provided
wikibaselexeme-lexeme-link-title:
{{optional}}

Value of the "title" attribute of a link to lexeme page when the lexeme is displayed as HTML.

Parameters:
* $1 - Lexeme ID
* $2 - Lexeme's "secondary label" (language and lexical category).
wikibaselexeme-newlexeme-fieldset: Title of the form in Special:NewLexeme
wikibaselexeme-newlexeme-info-panel-head: Heading for an info panel about Lexemes on Special:NewLexeme
wikibaselexeme-newlexeme-info-panel-lexi: First paragraph in an info panel on Special:NewLexeme explaining what a Lexeme is in one sentence. This paragraph is directly followed by an example of a Lexeme.
wikibaselexeme-newlexeme-info-panel-no-g: Paragraph in an info panel on Special:NewLexeme, explaining what distinguishes a Lexeme from an Item
wikibaselexeme-newlexeme-invalid-languag: Warning message displayed if the ISO 639-1 code of the item selected as the Lexeme's language is invalid. It would appear as part of the Lexeme Language Input. 'Below' refers to the 'Spelling Variant of the Lemma' field
wikibaselexeme-newlexeme-language: Label for field in the Lexeme creation form.
wikibaselexeme-newlexeme-language-empty-: Error message displayed when the Lexeme's language field is submitted empty
wikibaselexeme-newlexeme-language-invali: Error message displayed when the input to the Lexeme's language field is not a valid item
wikibaselexeme-newlexeme-language-placeh: Placeholder for the "language" field in the Lexeme creation form. Feel free to change "English" to your language name.

Placeholder for the "language" field in the Lexeme creation form.

Parameters:
* $1 - the name of an example language (already translated)

Will replace current placeholder message {{msg-mw|wikibaselexeme-newlexeme-language-placeholder}}
wikibaselexeme-newlexeme-lemma:
Label for "Lemma" in the lexeme creation form. This is the base form of the word, without the gloss. The placeholder in the input box is {{msg-mw|Wikibaselexeme-newlexeme-lemma-placeholder-with-example}}.

{{Identical|Lemma}}
wikibaselexeme-newlexeme-lemma-empty-err: Error message displayed when the lemma field is submitted empty
wikibaselexeme-newlexeme-lemma-language-: Error message displayed when the spelling variant field is submitted empty
{{notranslate}} This message is meant to be customized on an individual wiki, allowing to point to docs appropriate for that wiki.
Link text for a link next to the label for the spelling variant input ({{msg-mw|wikibaselexeme-newlexeme-lemma-language}}), linking to more documentation about it
Error message displayed when the input to the spelling variant field is not a valid language code.
Placeholder for the "Lemma" language (spelling variant) on the special page.

Placeholder for the "Lemma" language (spelling variant) on the special page.

Parameters:
* $1 - an example language code

Will replace current placeholder message {{msg-mw|wikibaselexeme-newlexeme-lemma-language-placeholder}}
wikibaselexeme-newlexeme-lemma-placehold:
Placeholder for the Lemma input field on the special page to create a new Lexeme.

Note that this is not necessarily an abbreviated form, but just a word reduced to its simplest lexical expression, i.e. without articles, particles, required complements, context of use, or notations. However it may be a lexicalized compound word.

Placeholder for the Lemma input field on the special page to create a new Lexeme.

Parameters:
* $1 - an example Lemma (likely already translated)

Will replace current placeholder message {{msg-mw|wikibaselexeme-newlexeme-lemma-placeholder}}
wikibaselexeme-newlexeme-lemma-too-long-:
Error message displayed when the lemma field submitted has too many characters. 

Parameters:
* $1 - allowed character limit (always expected to be significantly greater than one)
wikibaselexeme-newlexeme-lexicalcategory: Error message displayed when the lexical category field is submitted empty.
Error message displayed when the input to the lexical category field is not a valid Item.
Placeholder for the "lexical category" field in the Lexeme creation form.

Placeholder for the "lexical category" field in the Lexeme creation form.

Parameters:
* $1 - the name of an example lexical category (already translated)

Will replace current placeholder message {{msg-mw|wikibaselexeme-newlexeme-lexicalcategory-placeholder}}
wikibaselexeme-newlexeme-search-existing:
Instructions at the top of the special page to create a new Lexeme, to encourage users to check for duplicates.

Parameters:
* $1 - a URL to search for lexemes with the currently entered lemma text

"The help box below" refers to the info-panel messages, e.g. {{msg-mw|wikibaselexeme-newlexeme-info-panel-lexicographical-data}}.
wikibaselexeme-newlexeme-submit: Label on the button to create a new Lexeme
wikibaselexeme-newlexeme-submit-error: Error message for a generic network error
wikibaselexeme-newlexeme-submitting: Label on the button to create a new Lexeme, when the button was clicked and the Lexeme is currently being created. A variant of {{msg-mw|wikibaselexeme-newlexeme-submit}}.
wikibaselexeme-no-features: Message for form having no features
wikibaselexeme-presentation-lexeme-displ:
{{optional}}

Delimiter used to separate multiple lemmas of the lexeme when it being displayed as text/HTML.
wikibaselexeme-presentation-lexeme-secon:
{{optional}}

Lexeme's "secondary label" consisting of lexeme's language and lexical category (as text).

Parameters:
* $1 - Language
* $2 - Lexical category.
wikibaselexeme-search-result-stats:
Statistics display as part of search result. Parameters:
* $1 - Statements count, 
* $2 - Forms count.
wikibaselexeme-sense-gloss-invalid-langu: Error message to show if one or more sense glosses with invalid language codes are provided
wikibaselexeme-sense-gloss-redundant-lan: Error message to show if multiple glosses with the same language are provided.
wikibaselexeme-senseidformatter-layout:
{{optional}}

Format used when showing a sense ID, e.g. "cat (English) - domesticated subspecies of feline animal, commonly kept as a house pet".

Parameters:
* $1 - the lemma(s) of the associated lexeme
* $2 - the gloss in the user's language
* $3 - the label of the language item of the associated lexeme
wikibaselexeme-statementsection-statemen:
Heading for the list of statements giving specific information about the currently viewed Form of a Lexeme.

Parameters:
* $1 - Form ID.

The form ID string is left-to-right; to render correctly in right-to-left scripts, you will likely have to insert the Unicode formatting characters U+202B Right-To-Left Embedding (before start of $1) and U+202C POP Directional Formatting (after end of $1), as well as U+061C Arabic Letter Mark (Arabic-based scripts and Divehi) or U+200F Right-to-Left Mark (other right-to-left scripts) at the beginning of the string if $1 comes first.

Heading for the list of statements giving specific information about the currently viewed Sense of a Lexeme.

Parameters:
* $1 - Sense ID.

The sense ID string is left-to-right; to render correctly in right-to-left scripts, you will likely have to insert the Unicode formatting characters U+202B Right-To-Left Embedding (before start of $1) and U+202C POP Directional Formatting (after end of $1), as well as U+061C Arabic Letter Mark (Arabic-based scripts and Divehi) or U+200F Right-to-Left Mark (other right-to-left scripts) at the beginning of the string if $1 comes first.
